intro: Psychotria melintangensis, commonly known as the Melintang mountain psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are often fragrant. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in montane forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
